item.title: Trump impeached for 'inciting' US Capitol riot in historic second charge
item.description: Donald Trump becomes the first president in US history to be charged with misconduct in office twice.

item.title: Past Covid-19 infection may provide 'months of immunity'
item.description: But researchers warn there is still a risk of catching and passing the virus on to others again.

item.title: Australia: Spectacular ‘tree of life’ found in lake
item.description: An amateur photographer’s aerial photos are gaining attention for this little known "natural wonder".

item.title: Amazon faces legal challenge over Prime cancellation policy
item.description: Consumer watchdogs say the manipulative "dark pattern" design makes it hard for people to end membership.

item.title: Uganda elections 2021: Bobi Wine takes on Yoweri Museveni
item.description: The internet is shut down following a campaign in which dozens of people were killed.

item.title: Meng Wanzhou: Bullets sent in mail to Huawei's finance chief
item.description: Under house arrest in Canada on bank fraud charges, Ms Meng has reportedly received death threats.

item.title: Park Geun-hye: South Korea court upholds 20-year jail term for ex-leader
item.description: A final Supreme Court ruling upheld a reduced sentence for disgraced former president Park Geun-hye.

item.title: Twitter boss: Trump ban is 'right' but 'dangerous'
item.description: Jack Dorsey acknowledges that banning the president undermines the ideals of an open internet.

item.title: Flint water crisis: Michigan charges ex-governor Rick Snyder
item.description: It follows a new investigation into the deadly contamination of water in the Michigan city in 2014.

item.title: New York City is latest to cut Trump business ties
item.description: The Trump Organization has contracts with the city to run skating rinks, a carousel and a golf course.

item.title: Coronavirus: British tourist blamed for Lauberhorn ski race cancellation
item.description: The famous Lauberhorn ski event is cancelled after a spike in Covid-19 cases linked to one tourist.

item.title: US pet food recalled after 70 dogs die and others fall sick
item.description: Tests on the pet food have shown potentially unsafe levels of aflatoxins, a by-product of mould.

item.title: Rap against Dictatorship: The rappers taking on Thailand's leaders
item.description: Thai group Rap Against Dictatorship is known for its outspoken comments against the military and monarchy,

item.title: How did the pilot survive this plane crash?
item.description: Surveillance footage shows the moment a plane fell out of the sky in Oyster Bay, New York.

item.title: Indonesia: Archaeologists find world's oldest animal cave painting
item.description: The life-sized picture of a wild pig found in a remote cave is thought to be 45,000 years old.

item.title: The anti-gay row that inspired a rugby film
item.description: A new documentary shows the world's first gay rugby club challenging conventional perceptions.

item.title: How RuPaul's Drag Race UK faced Covid challenge
item.description: The queens of season two discuss coronavirus shutting production down, and how life changed for their drag.

item.title: Stroud GP vaccinates her father against Covid-19
item.description: A GP in Stroud has been able to vaccinate her father, and see him for the first time since March.

item.title: Wonder Woman 1984: Actress Lilly Aspell reveals how a chance encounter led her to the role
item.description: Lilly Aspell got the Wonder Woman 1984 part despite never acting before and does all her own stunts.

item.title: The password guess worth $240m in bitcoin...
item.description: A programmer is trying to remember the password to unlock a digital wallet set up a decade ago.

item.title: CES 2021: Is this the world's smartest face mask?
item.description: Gaming company Razer claims to have made the world's most technologically advanced mask

item.title: Has coronavirus made us more ethical consumers?
item.description: Studies show shoppers on both sides of the Atlantic are more ethically and environmentally minded.

item.title: The country vaccinating younger people first
item.description: Instead of inoculating the elderly, Indonesia is focusing on working-age adults. Will it succeed?

item.title: How much can Joe Biden get done on the US economy?
item.description: The new US president may have more scope to make change than initially thought.

item.title: Evaristo de Macedo: The record-breaking Brazilian loved by Barca & Madrid
item.description: Barcelona's first Brazilian striker left for Real Madrid, managed Iraq with Saddam Hussein's son and beat Pele to a goalscoring record.

item.title: Huawei patent mentions use of Uighur-spotting tech
item.description: The company denies selling technology that can identify the ethnic group and plans to reword the patent.

item.title: Sheldon Adelson, the casino magnate who moved an embassy
item.description: Sheldon Adelson, the son of Jewish immigrants who became one of the world's richest men, dies at 87.

item.title: Viewpoint: Global media's Nigeria abductions coverage 'wrong'
item.description: Novelist Adaobi Tricia Nwaubani criticises coverage of the kidnapping of schoolchildren.

item.title: Manchester City 1-0 Brighton: Pep Guardiola's side back in the Premier League title race
item.description: With Manchester City just four points off the top, England midfielder Phil Foden has played a big part in getting City back in the Premier League title race.

item.title: Tottenham Hotspur 1-1 Fulham: Ivan Cavaleiro earns a point for Premier League strugglers
item.description: Ivan Cavaleiro's late header earns Premier League strugglers Fulham a hard-fought draw against Tottenham in their hastily rearranged London derby.

item.title: Nets beat Knicks amid claims of Harden signing from Rockets
item.description: James Harden reportedly completes a move from Houston Rockets to Brooklyn Nets, while LeBron James and the LA Lakers win again.

item.title: US players 'need to make sacrifices' in fight for equal pay
item.description: Former United States goalkeeper Hope Solo discusses equal pay for female footballers on The Players podcast.

item.title: Moment Trump impeached for second time
item.description: The US House of Representatives has voted with a trial due to begin in the Senate in the coming days.

item.title: Trump impeachment: Republicans defend - and some attack - president
item.description: Ten Republicans voted to impeach the president this time - but most in the party came to his defence.

item.title: Americans react to historic second Trump impeachment
item.description: Our voter panel is divided over the charge of incitement with Trump supporters warning it will deepen divisions.

item.title: Trump impeachment: What happens to impeached presidents?
item.description: Johnson, Nixon and Clinton: Mr Trump follows three US presidents who have already faced impeachment.

item.title: Capitol riots: Did Trump's words at rally incite violence?
item.description: Donald Trump stands accused of inciting violence that left five people dead. So what did the president say?
